Transcendent Lineage.name: Transcendent Lineage
Transcendent Lineage.description: *Benefit:* When you use your _memory of a thousand lifetimes_ racial power, you can reroll the die and add either result to the triggering roll.

Shard Link.name: Shard Link
Shard Link.description: Once during each of your turns, when you attack an enemy that you have combat advantage against, choose one ally within range of your telepathy. The ally gains combat advantage on his or her next attack against that enemy made before the start of your next turn.
Shard Link.prerequisites: shardmind, telepathy racial trait, any psionic class

Implement Expertise.name: Implement Expertise
Implement Expertise.description: Choose a type of implement. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with any implement power you use through that type of implement. The bonus increases to +2 at 15th level and +3 at 25th level.
Implement Expertise.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, choose a different type of implement.

Psionic Rush [Augment].name: Psionic Rush [Augment]
Psionic Rush [Augment].description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you can reduce the cost to augment any augmentable power you use during that action by 1 power point.

Radiant Fist's Action (Radiant Fist).name: Radiant Fist's Action (Radiant Fist)
Radiant Fist's Action (Radiant Fist).description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you regain 15 hit points. Until the end of your next turn, your attacks deal extra radiant damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Liberating Shard Swarm.name: Liberating Shard Swarm
Liberating Shard Swarm.description: When you use your shard swarm, you can also make a saving throw.

Time-Lapse Time Bender Path Feature.name: Time-Lapse Time Bender Path Feature
Time-Lapse Time Bender Path Feature.description: When you spend an action point to make an attack with a psionic power, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll and can teleport 6 squares as a free action after the attack.

Sneak Attack (Rogue).name: Sneak Attack (Rogue)
Sneak Attack (Rogue).description:
Once per round, when you have combat advantage against an enemy and are using a weapon from the light blade, the crossbow, or the sling weapon group, an attack you make against that enemy deals extra damage if the attack hits. You decide whether to apply the extra damage after making the damage roll. As you advance in level, your extra damage increases.


Level             |  Sneak Attack Damage
----------  |  -------------------
1st-10th       |  +2d6
11st-20th     |  +3d6
21st-30th     |  +5d6

Dual Challenge.name: Dual Challenge
Dual Challenge.description: Whenever you mark an enemy with Combat Challenge, you can mark one additional enemy adjacent to that enemy. This mark lasts until the end ofyour next turn.
Dual Challenge.prerequisites: 21st level, fighter, Combat Challenge class feature

Martial Alacrity.name: Martial Alacrity
Martial Alacrity.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to initiative checks. Also, during your first turn in an encounter, you can shift as a minor action.

Dagger Advantage (Daggermaster).name: Dagger Advantage (Daggermaster)
Dagger Advantage (Daggermaster).description: When you score a critical hit with a dagger, the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Eyes in the Back of Your Head.name: Eyes in the Back of Your Head
Eyes in the Back of Your Head.description: Being flanked doesn't cause you to grant combat advantage.
Eyes in the Back of Your Head.id: Eyes in the Back of Your Head

Rogue Weapon Mastery.name: Rogue Weapon Mastery
Rogue Weapon Mastery.description:
When you wield a dagger or shuriken the weapon gains the high crit property.

**High Crit**: A high crit weapon deals more damage when you score a critical hit with it. A critical hit deals maximum weapon damage and an extra 1[W] at 1st–10th levels, an extra 2[W] at 11th–20th levels, and an extra 3[W] at 21st–30th levels. This extra damage is in addition to any critical damage the weapon supplies if it is a magic weapon.

Deft Blade.name: Deft Blade
Deft Blade.description: When you make a basic attack using a light blade,you can target AC or Reflex.

Halfling Agility.name: Halfling Agility
Halfling Agility.description: When you use your halfling _second chance_ ability, the attacker takes a -2 penalty to the new attack roll.

Expansive Burst.name: Expansive Burst
Expansive Burst.description: Your close burst and area burst attacks ignore cover, but not superior cover.

Fey Trickster.name: Fey Trickster
Fey Trickster.description: You gain the wizard cantrips _mage hand_ and _prestidigitation_ as encounter powers.

Arcane Admixture.name: Arcane Admixture
Arcane Admixture.description:
Choose one arcane power that you know and choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The power now deals that damage type in addition to its normal damage type and gains that keyword.

Each time you gain a level, you can choose to reassign either the power to which this feat's effect applies or the additional damage type applied (or both).
Arcane Admixture.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose a different power. You can't apply this feat to the same power more than once.

Arcane Mastery.name: Arcane Mastery
Arcane Mastery.description: Once per encounter, you can spend an action point to regain the use of a daily wizard power you've already used today, instead of taking an extra action.

Improved Second Wind.name: Improved Second Wind
Improved Second Wind.description: When you use your second wind, you heal an additional 5 hit points.

Battle Sovereignty [Invincible Mind Path.name: Battle Sovereignty [Invincible Mind Path Feature]
Battle Sovereignty [Invincible Mind Path.description: You gain a +10 bonus to initiative checks and a +2 bonus to weapon attack rolls.

Borrow from the Future Time Bender Path.name: Borrow from the Future Time Bender Path Feature
Borrow from the Future Time Bender Path.description: You can take an extra move action during your turn, but if you do so, you lose your move action on your next turn. You can't use this feature on consecutive rounds.
Borrow from the Future Time Bender Path.id: Borrow from the Future Time Bender Path Feature

Steel Defense Action (Swordmaster).name: Steel Defense Action (Swordmaster)
Steel Defense Action (Swordmaster).description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you also gain a +4 bonus to AC and Reflex defense until the start of your next turn.

Defense Bonuses (Human).name: Defense Bonuses (Human)
Defense Bonuses (Human).description: +1 to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will defenses.

Oncoming Storm.name: Oncoming Storm
Oncoming Storm.description: When you hit with any lightning attack power, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with thunder powers until the end of your next turn.

Weapon Focus.name: Weapon Focus
Weapon Focus.description: Choose a specific weapon group, such as spears or heavy blades. You gain a +1 feat bonus to damage rolls with your chosen weapon group. At 11th level, this bonus increases to +2. At 21st level, it increases to +3.
Weapon Focus.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose another weapon group.

Unarmored Defense (Monk).name: Unarmored Defense (Monk)
Unarmored Defense (Monk).description: While you are wearing cloth armor or no armor and aren't using a shield, you gain a +2 bonus to AC.

Far Shot.name: Far Shot
Far Shot.description: When you use a projectile weapon such as a bow or a crossbow, increase both the normal range and the long range by 5 squares.

Trusted Spellcasting.name: Trusted Spellcasting
Trusted Spellcasting.description: Choose one arcane encounter attack power that you know and that does not already deal damage on a miss. That power now deals half damage on a miss.

Unarmed Combatant (Monk).name: Unarmed Combatant (Monk)
Unarmed Combatant (Monk).description: You can make unarmed attacks with much greater effectiveness than most other combatants can. When you make a weapon attack such as a melee basic attack. you can use the monk unarmed strike, which is a weapon in the unarmed weapon group. This weapon has the off-hand weapon property and a +3 proficiency bonus, and it deals 1d8 damage. You must have a hand free to use your monk unarmed strike, even if you're kicking, kneeing, elbowing, or head­-butting a target. Your monk unarmed strike can't be turned into a magic weapon, but it can benefit from a magic ki focus if you have one.

Becoming the One Demiurge Feature.name: Becoming the One Demiurge Feature
Becoming the One Demiurge Feature.description: Your Charisma score and one other ability score of your choice both increase by 2.

Durable.name: Durable
Durable.description: Increase your number of healing surges by two.

Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
Powerful Charge.description: When you charge, you gain a +2 bonus to damage and a +2 bonus to bull rush attempts.

Gritty Determination.name: Gritty Determination
Gritty Determination.description: Whenever you use a daily attack power, you gain temporary hit points equal to one-half your level + your Constitution modifier.

Mobile Warrior.name: Mobile Warrior
Mobile Warrior.description: When you make an attack with a flail, a heavy blade, a light blade, or a spear, you can shift 1 square after resolving the attack, whether or not it hits.

Defensive Aura [Talaric Ironjack Path Fe.name: Defensive Aura [Talaric Ironjack Path Feature]
Defensive Aura [Talaric Ironjack Path Fe.description: Whenever you hit with an unaugmented at-will psionic attack power while you have at least 1 power point, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn,

Discern Asshole.name: Discern Asshole
Discern Asshole.description: You are able to discern if the player is an asshole, or not.

Linguist.name: Linguist
Linguist.description: Learn three new languages. You can now speak, read, and write those languages fluently.
Linguist.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose three new languages to learn.

Nimble Reaction (Halfling).name: Nimble Reaction (Halfling)
Nimble Reaction (Halfling).description: You gain a +2 racial bonus to AC against opportunity attacks.

Twist the Arcane Fabric.name: Twist the Arcane Fabric
Twist the Arcane Fabric.description: Before you use an area or close arcane power, you can use a free action to expend your _fey step_ racial power to teleport an ally rather than yourself. If you do so, select one ally within the area of effect targeted by the arcane power and teleport that ally 3 sqaures.

Arcane Reserves.name: Arcane Reserves
Arcane Reserves.description: Ifall your arcane encounter attack powers are expended, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with your arcane at-will attack powers until the end ofthe encounter or until you regain the use of one ofyour arcane encounter attack powers.

Lost in the Crowd.name: Lost in the Crowd
Lost in the Crowd.description: You gain a +2 bonus to AC when you are adjacent to at least two enemies larger than you.

Loan from the Past Time Bender Path Feat.name: Loan from the Past Time Bender Path Feature
Loan from the Past Time Bender Path Feat.description: Whenever you roll initiative, roll an additional d20. Once during that encounter, you can replace an attack roll, a skill check, an ability check, or a saving throw with that roll.
Loan from the Past Time Bender Path Feat.id: Loan from the Past Time Bender Path Feature

Wizard Implement Expertise.name: Wizard Implement Expertise
Wizard Implement Expertise.description: When you wield a wizard implement while using an arcane power, you can score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

Light Blade Precision.name: Light Blade Precision
Light Blade Precision.description: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with light blades against Large or larger targets.

Defensive Advantage.name: Defensive Advantage
Defensive Advantage.description: When you have combat advantage against an enemy, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against that enemy’s attacks.

Advantage of Cunning.name: Advantage of Cunning
Advantage of Cunning.description: When you slide an ally with your Virtue of Cunning, you can also slide an enemy that was adjacent to that ally into the space the ally vacated.
Advantage of Cunning.prerequisites: Bard, Virtue of Cunning class feature

Moradin's Resolve.name: Moradin's Resolve
Moradin's Resolve.description: You can invoke the power of your deity to use _Moradin's resolve_.
Moradin's Resolve.prerequisites: Channel Divinity class feature, must worship Moradin

Improved Rageblood Vigor.name: Improved Rageblood Vigor
Improved Rageblood Vigor.description: You gain 5 additional temporary hit points from your Rageblood Vigor.

Improved Tome of Readiness.name: Improved Tome of Readiness
Improved Tome of Readiness.description: After you prepare your daily and utility wizard powers after an extended rest, choose one daily or utility power in your spellbook that you didn't prepare and store this power in your tome.
Improved Tome of Readiness.prerequisites: 11th level, Con 13, Wis 13, wizard, Tome of Readiness class feature

Rogue Weapon Talent (Rogue).name: Rogue Weapon Talent (Rogue)
Rogue Weapon Talent (Rogue).description: When you wield a shuriken, your weapon damage die increases by one size. When you wield a dagger, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls.

Improved Armor of Faith.name: Improved Armor of Faith
Improved Armor of Faith.description:
While you are neither wearing heavy armor nor using a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

The bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

Dragonborn Frenzy.name: Dragonborn Frenzy
Dragonborn Frenzy.description: While you are bloodied, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

Toughness.name: Toughness
Toughness.description: When you take this feat, you gain additional hit points. You gain an additional 5 hit points at each tier of play (at 1st, 11th, and 21st level).

Energy Essence (Essence Mage).name: Energy Essence (Essence Mage)
Energy Essence (Essence Mage).description: If you hit with an arcane attack power that deals more than one type of damage, you deal 1d6 extra damage.

Combat Superiority.name: Combat Superiority
Combat Superiority.description: You gain a bonus to opportunity attacks equal to your Wisdom modifier. An enemy struck by your opportunity attack stops moving, if a move provoked the attack. If it still has actions remaining, it can use them to resume moving.

Cursed Advantage.name: Cursed Advantage
Cursed Advantage.description: You gain combat advantage against bloodied enemies cursed by you.
Cursed Advantage.prerequisites: Drow, warlock, Warlock's Curse class feature

Versatile Expertise.name: Versatile Expertise
Versatile Expertise.description: Choose a weapon group and an implement type. You gain a +1 feat bonus to attack rolls both when using a weapon from the chosen group and when using an implement of the chosen type. The bonus increases to +2 at 15th level and +3 at 25th level.
Versatile Expertise.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, choose a different weapon group and a different implement type.

Agile Hunter.name: Agile Hunter
Agile Hunter.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee attack against the target of your Hunter's Quarry, you can shift as a free action, and the enemy takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
Agile Hunter.prerequisites: Dex 15, Ranger, Hunter's Quarry class feature

Auspicious Lineage.name: Auspicious Lineage
Auspicious Lineage.description: When you use your memory of a thousand lifetimes racial power, you add 1d8 to the triggering roll, instead of 1d6.

Raging Storm.name: Raging Storm
Raging Storm.description:
You gain a +1 feat bonus to damage rolls when you use a power that has the lightning or thunder keyword.

At 11th level, this bonus increases to +2. At 21st level, it increases to +3.

Skill Focus.name: Skill Focus
Skill Focus.description: Choose a skill in which you have training. You have a +3 feat bonus to checks with that skill.
Skill Focus.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose a different skill.

Two-Weapon Flurry.name: Two-Weapon Flurry
Two-Weapon Flurry.description: While holding a melee weapon in each hand, if you make a successful opportunity attack with your primary weapon, you can also make an opportunity attack with your off-hand weapon against the same target (but with a –5 penalty to the attack roll).

Epic Fortitude.name: Epic Fortitude
Epic Fortitude.description: You gain a +4 bonus to Fortitude.

Threefold Reflex [Augment].name: Threefold Reflex [Augment]
Threefold Reflex [Augment].description:
You gain a +1 feat bonus to Reflex.

During your turn, you can spend 1 power point to increase the bonus to +3 until the end ofyour next turn.

Destructive Wizardry.name: Destructive Wizardry
Destructive Wizardry.description:
When you use an arcane attack power and hit two or more creatures, you gain a +2 bonus to that power's damage rolls.
This bonus increases to +3 at 11th level and to +4 at 21st level.

Action Surge.name: Action Surge
Action Surge.description: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls you make during any action you gained by spending an action point.

Deadly Rage.name: Deadly Rage
Deadly Rage.description: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls while raging. The bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

Channel Divinity.name: Channel Divinity
Channel Divinity.description: You gain the Channel Divinity class feature, which means you can use a single _Channel Divinity_ power once per encounter. You also gain a divinity feat of your choice.

Hidden Sniper.name: Hidden Sniper
Hidden Sniper.description: If you have partial concealment against a target, you gain combat advantage against it with your ranged attacks.

Healing Hands.name: Healing Hands
Healing Hands.description: When you use the _lay on hands_ power, the affected ally regains additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Improved Initiative.name: Improved Initiative
Improved Initiative.prerequisites: You gain a +4 feat bonus to initiative checks.

Sieze the Moment.name: Sieze the Moment
Sieze the Moment.description: During the first round of combat and during surprise rounds, you automatically gain combat advantage over a foe whose initiative result is lower than yours.

Quickened Spellcasting.name: Quickened Spellcasting
Quickened Spellcasting.description: Choose an arcane at-will attack power that is used as a standard action. Once per encounter, you can use that power as a minor action.

Skill Power.name: Skill Power
Skill Power.description: You gain a skill power of your level or lower from a skill in which you are trained.

Reckless Scramble.name: Reckless Scramble
Reckless Scramble.description: When a power lets you shift, you can instead choose to move that distance + 2 squares.

Tempest Magic.name: Tempest Magic
Tempest Magic.description:
When you use an arcane power that has the lightning or thunder keyword, you gain a +1 feat bonus to damage rolls. While you are bloodied, this bonus becomes +2.

At 11th level, this bonus increases to +2 (or +4 when bloodied). At 21st level, it increases to +3 (or +6 when bloodied).
Tempest Magic.prerequisites: Sorcerer, Con 13, Dex 13, Storm Magic class feature

Opportunistic Withdrawl.name: Opportunistic Withdrawl
Opportunistic Withdrawl.description: While you are adjacent to an enemy granting combat advantage to you, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that enemy.

Storm's Embrace (Storm Magic).name: Storm's Embrace (Storm Magic)
Storm's Embrace (Storm Magic).description: When you roll a natural 20 on an attack roll for an arcane power, wind surges around you and your enemy. You can push the target 1 square and then fly a number of squares equal to 1 + your Dexterity modifier after applying the attack's other effects.

Echoes of Thunder.name: Echoes of Thunder
Echoes of Thunder.description: When you hit with any thunder attack power, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn. The bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

Two-Weapon Fighting.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
Two-Weapon Fighting.description: While holding a melee weapon in each hand, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with your main weapon.

Demand's Reach.name: Demand's Reach
Demand's Reach.description: The burst of your battlemind's demand increases to 5.

Sorcerous Vision.name: Sorcerous Vision
Sorcerous Vision.description: Whenever you would make a Perception check or an Insight check, you can make an Arcana check instead.

Improved Misty Step.name: Improved Misty Step
Improved Misty Step.description: Your Misty Step now allows you to teleport an additional 2 squares.

Improved Majestic Word.name: Improved Majestic Word
Improved Majestic Word.description: When you use _majestic word_, the target of the power gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Spontaneous Resurrection (Undying Warrio.name: Spontaneous Resurrection (Undying Warrior)
Spontaneous Resurrection (Undying Warrio.description:
When you die, you can return to life at the start of your next turn. Doing this doesn’t require an action. You appear in a space of your choice within 5 squares of where you died and have hit points equal to your bloodied value. You are freed of any temporary effects existing at the time of your death, but permanent conditions remain. Each additional time you are slain during the same day increases the time until you can rise again.

_Second Death:_ Return to life at the end of the encounter.

_Third Death:_ Return to life 1 hour after the end of the encounter.

_Fourth Death:_ Return to life 12 hours after the end of the encounter.

_Fifth Death or More:_ Return to life 24 hours after the end of the encounter.

If you don’t use this ability, you can still be raised from the dead normally.

Anger Unleashed.name: Anger Unleashed
Anger Unleashed.description: The first time you are bloodied during an encounter, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Daunting Challenge.name: Daunting Challenge
Daunting Challenge.description: Creatures marked by you take a -3 penalty to attack rolls for any attack that doesn’t include you as a target (rather than a -2 penalty).
Daunting Challenge.prerequisites: 11th level, fighter, Combat Challenge class feature

Elven Precision.name: Elven Precision
Elven Precision.description: When you use the _elven accuracy_ power, you gain a +2 bonus to the new attack roll.

Fighter Weapon Talent.name: Fighter Weapon Talent
Fighter Weapon Talent.description: Choose either one-handed or two-handed weapons. When using a weapon of your chosen style, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls.

Focused Wizardry.name: Focused Wizardry
Focused Wizardry.description: When you use an arcane burst or blast attack power and only one creature is within the area of effect, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

Human Perseverance.name: Human Perseverance
Human Perseverance.description: You gain a +1 feat bonus to saving throws.

Dagger Precision (Daggermaster).name: Dagger Precision (Daggermaster)
Dagger Precision (Daggermaster).description: You can score critical hits with daggers on a roll of 18–20.

Bardic Knowledge.name: Bardic Knowledge
Bardic Knowledge.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Arcana, Dungeoneering, History, Nature, Religion, and Streetwise checks.

Reckless Attacker.name: Reckless Attacker
Reckless Attacker.description: When you score a critical hit with a fighter attack power, you can make a melee basic attack as a free action. If you do so, you take a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

Paragon Defenses.name: Paragon Defenses
Paragon Defenses.description: You gain a +1 feat bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will.

Two-Weapon Defense.name: Two-Weapon Defense
Two-Weapon Defense.description: While holding a melee weapon in each hand, you gain a +1 shield bonus to AC and Reflex.

Rising Fury.name: Rising Fury
Rising Fury.description: When you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points, you gain a +2 feat bonus to weapon damage rolls until the end of your next turn. The bonus increases to +3 at 11th level and +4 at 21st level.

Rogue Tactics (Rogue).name: Rogue Tactics (Rogue)
Rogue Tactics (Rogue).description:
Rogues operate in a variety of ways. Some rogues use their natural charm and cunning trickery to deceive foes. Others rely on brute strength to overcome their enemies.

Choose one of the following options:

**Artful Dodger**: You gain a bonus to AC equal to your Charisma modifier against opportunity attacks.

**Brutal Scoundrel**: You gain a bonus to Sneak Attack damage equal to your Strength modifier.

The choice you make also provides bonuses to certain rogue powers. Individual powers detail the effects (if any) your Rogue Tactics selection has on them.

Potent Rebirth.name: Potent Rebirth
Potent Rebirth.description: When you drop to 0 hit points or fewer, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the encounter.

Fervent Talent [Mutliclass Ardent].name: Fervent Talent [Mutliclass Ardent]
Fervent Talent [Mutliclass Ardent].description: You gain training in one skiIl from the ardent's class skills list.\n\nOnce per day, you can use the ardent's ardent surge power.

Iron Propulsion.name: Iron Propulsion
Iron Propulsion.description: While you have at least 1 power point, you ignore the speed penalty normally incurred by your armor.

Radiant Power.name: Radiant Power
Radiant Power.description:
When you make an implement attack, you can take a –2 penalty to the attack roll. If you do so and the attack hits, it deals 2 extra radiant damage.

The extra radiant damage increases to 4 at 11th level and 6 at 21st level.

Improved Dragon Soul.name: Improved Dragon Soul
Improved Dragon Soul.description: The resistance granted by your Dragon Soul increases by 2. The increase changes to 5 at 11th level and 10 at 21st level.

Marked Fury.name: Marked Fury
Marked Fury.description: If an adjacent enemy that is marked by you makes an attack that doesn't include you as a target, it takes a penalty to the attack roll equal to either -2 or the number of enemies adjacent to you, whichever is worse. This penalty replaces the normal penalty for having a creature marked.

Expanded Spellbook.name: Expanded Spellbook
Expanded Spellbook.description:
Choose one daily wizard attack spell of every level you know. Add this spell to your spellbook.
Each time you gain a new level of daily wizard attack spells, you learn one extra spell of that level (in
other words, add three spells to your spellbook instead of only two).
This feat doesn't change the number of daily attack spells you can prepare each day.

Undying Stamina (Undying Warrior).name: Undying Stamina (Undying Warrior)
Undying Stamina (Undying Warrior).description: Each time you reach a milestone, you regain 1d4 healing surges.

Devastating Critical.name: Devastating Critical
Devastating Critical.description: When you score a critical hit, you deal an extra 1d10 damage.

Defiant Fire.name: Defiant Fire
Defiant Fire.description: The first time you are bloodied during an encounter, you gain a use of your battle resilience that you can use only the next time you are hit or missed during the encounter.

Wounded Resurgence (Undying Warrior).name: Wounded Resurgence (Undying Warrior)
Wounded Resurgence (Undying Warrior).description: If you are bloodied, you can spend a healing surge as a minor action to restore your current hit points to your bloodied value. Also, you don’t take a death penalty when you are returned to life by the Raise Dead ritual.

Lethal Hunter.name: Lethal Hunter
Lethal Hunter.description: The extra damage dice from your Hunter's Quarry class feature increase from d6s to d8s.

Light Step.name: Light Step
Light Step.description:
For the purpose of hourly or daily travel rates, add 1 to your overland speed and the speed of all allies in your traveling group.
Add 5 to the DC required to find of follow your tracks. If traveling with allies, you can share this benefit with up to five other characters.
You gain a +1 feat bonus to Acrobatics checks and Stealth checks.

Ironjack's Command [Talaric Ironjack Pat.name: Ironjack's Command [Talaric Ironjack Path Feature]
Ironjack's Command [Talaric Ironjack Pat.description: Whenever you spend a healing surge and regain hit points, each ally within 2 squares of you can shift 1 square as a free action.

Unarmored Agility (Monk).name: Unarmored Agility (Monk)
Unarmored Agility (Monk).description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to AC while wearing either cloth armor or no armor.

Deceptive Mind.name: Deceptive Mind
Deceptive Mind.description: You gain a +2 bonus to all defenses while your battle resilience is in effect.

Ritual Caster.name: Ritual Caster
Ritual Caster.description: You can master and perform rituals of your level or lower. See Chapter 10 for information on acquiring, mastering, and performing rituals. Even though some rituals use the Heal skill or the Nature skill, the Arcana skill or the Religion skill is required to understand how to perform rituals.

Combat Challenge.name: Combat Challenge
Combat Challenge.description:
In combat, it’s dangerous to ignore a fighter. Every time you attack an enemy, whether the attack hits or misses, you can choose to mark that target. The mark lasts until the end of your next turn. While a target is marked, it takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls for any attack that doesn’t include you as a target. A creature can be subject to only one mark at a time. A new mark supersedes a mark that was already in place.

In addition, whenever a marked enemy that is adjacent to you shifts or makes an attack that does not include you, you can make a melee basic attack against that enemy as an immediate interrupt.

Avenging Spirit.name: Avenging Spirit
Avenging Spirit.description: When an ally of your level or higher is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, you gain an action point that you must use before the end of your next turn or the action point is lost. You must see or hear the ally when he or she is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer to gain this feat’s benefit.
Avenging Spirit.prerequisites: 11th level, human fighter or human warlord

Steel Grace (Swordmaster).name: Steel Grace (Swordmaster)
Steel Grace (Swordmaster).description: When you charge with a light blade or a heavy blade that is not a pole-arm, you can use _Containing Strike_ or _Reaping Strike_ instead of your melee basic attack.

Paragon Power Points Time Bender Path Fe.name: Paragon Power Points Time Bender Path Feature
Paragon Power Points Time Bender Path Fe.id: Paragon Power Points Time Bender Path Feature

Defense Mobility.name: Defense Mobility
Defense Mobility.description: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against opportunity attacks.

Bold (Halfling).name: Bold (Halfling)
Bold (Halfling).description: You gain a +5 racial bonus to saving throws against fear.

First Strike (Rogue).name: First Strike (Rogue)
First Strike (Rogue).description: At the start of an encounter, you have combat advantage against any creatures that have not yet acted in that encounter.

Storm Power (Storm Magic).name: Storm Power (Storm Magic)
Storm Power (Storm Magic).description: You gain a bonus to the damage rolls of arcane powers equal to your Dexterity modifier. The bonus equals your Dexterity modifier + 2 at 11th level and your Dexterity modifier + 4 at 21st level.

Armor of Bahamut.name: Armor of Bahamut
Armor of Bahamut.description: You can invoke the power of your deity to use _Armor of Bahamut_.
Armor of Bahamut.prerequisites: Channel Divinity class feature, must worship Bahamut

Superior Action [Talaric Ironjack Path F.name: Superior Action [Talaric Ironjack Path Feature]
Superior Action [Talaric Ironjack Path F.description: When you spend an action point to make an attack, you gain a +4 power bonus to the attack roll and you regain hit points equal to twice your Constitution modifier.

Weapon Proficiency.name: Weapon Proficiency
Weapon Proficiency.description: You gain proficiency in a single weapon of your choice.
Weapon Proficiency.special: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose another weapon.

Steel Blitz (Swordmaster).name: Steel Blitz (Swordmaster)
Steel Blitz (Swordmaster).description: When you score a critical hit with a light blade or a heavy blade, you regain the use of a fighter encounter power you’ve already used in the encounter.

Jack of All Trades.name: Jack of All Trades
Jack of All Trades.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to all untrained skill checks.

Spell Accuracy.name: Spell Accuracy
Spell Accuracy.description: You can omit a number of squares from the area of effect of any of your area or close wizard powers. This number can't exceed your Wisdom modifier.

Guaranteed Retribution.name: Guaranteed Retribution
Guaranteed Retribution.description: When any enemy other than your oath of enmity target hits you, you gain a +1 feat bonus to attack rolls against your oath of enmity target until the end of your next turn.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description:
You can draw a weapon (or an object stored in a belt pouch, bandolier, or similar container, such as a potion) as part of the same action used to attack with the weapon or use the object.

You also gain a +2 feat bonus to initiative checks.

Backstabber.name: Backstabber
Backstabber.description: The extra damage dice from your Sneak Attack class feature increase from d6s to d8s.

Armored Swiftness Training.name: Armored Swiftness Training
Armored Swiftness Training.description: You don't take an armor check penalty to your Dexterity-based skill checks.

Press the Advantage.name: Press the Advantage
Press the Advantage.description: If you score a critical hit while you have combat advantage, you gain combat advantage against the target until the end of your next turn.

Flanking Maneuver.name: Flanking Maneuver
Flanking Maneuver.description:
You can move diagonally even if a wall corner normally blocks such movement.

You can move through enemies’ spaces. You provoke opportunity attacks for this movement as normal. You can’t end your move in an enemy’s space.

Mental Bastion.name: Mental Bastion
Mental Bastion.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Will. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

Point-Blank Shot.name: Point-Blank Shot
Point-Blank Shot.description: If you make a ranged attack against a foe within 5 squares of you, your attack ignores cover and concealment, including superior cover but not total concealment.

Cull the Weak.name: Cull the Weak
Cull the Weak.description: When you have combat advantage against a bloodied or weakened target, you gain a +2 bonus to melee weapon damage rolls against the target.

Power Attack.name: Power Attack
Power Attack.description:
When making a melee attack, you can take a -2 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll (or a +3 bonus to the damage roll with a two-handed weapon).

This extra damage increases by level, as shown on the table below, but the attack penalty remains the same:

1st-10th - +2 (+3 two-handed)
11th-20th - +4 (+6 two-handed)
21st-30th - +6 (9 two-handed)

Daggermaster's Action (Daggermaster).name: Daggermaster's Action (Daggermaster)
Daggermaster's Action (Daggermaster).description: You can spend an action point to re-roll one attack roll or damage roll you made using a dagger, instead of taking an extra action.

Essential Action (Essence Mage).name: Essential Action (Essence Mage)
Essential Action (Essence Mage).description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you gain a +4 bonus to attack rolls with arcane powers until the start of your next turn.

Dooming Action.name: Dooming Action
Dooming Action.description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action and you have already dealt your Warlock's Curse extra damage during your current turn, you can deal the extra damage a second time during this turn.

Storm Soul (Storm Magic).name: Storm Soul (Storm Magic)
Storm Soul (Storm Magic).description:
You gain resist 5 thunder and resist 5 lightning. This resistance increases to 10 at 11th level and 15 at 21st level. While this resistance is active, your arcane powers ignore all targets' resistance to that damage type up to the value of your resistance.

If you are hit by an attack, you can end this resistance as an immediate interrupt to gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn. If you do so, the resistance returns after you take a short rest or an extended rest.

Crashing Tempest Style.name: Crashing Tempest Style
Crashing Tempest Style.description: While you are wielding a club, you gain a +2 bonus to damage dealt by your _Flurry of Blows_ power.
Crashing Tempest Style.prerequisites: Monk, Flurry of Blows class feature

Essential Resistance (Essence Mage).name: Essential Resistance (Essence Mage)
Essential Resistance (Essence Mage).description: Whenever you gain resistance, increase that resistance by 3 (or by 4 at 21st level and higher).

Evasive Footwork.name: Evasive Footwork
Evasive Footwork.description: When you shift 2 or more squares on your turn, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and Reflex until the start of your next turn.

Rending Tempest.name: Rending Tempest
Rending Tempest.description: When you hit a target with a melee attack using two weapons during your turn, your subsequent melee attacks against the target deal 1[W] extra damage on a hit during the same turn.

Avandra's Gift.name: Avandra's Gift
Avandra's Gift.description: When you use your _second change_ racial power and the enemy's attack misses, you gain combat advantage for the next attack roll you make against that enemy before the end of your next turn.

Empowering Shadows.name: Empowering Shadows
Empowering Shadows.description: When you have concealment from your Shadow Walk, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls.

Ascendant Lineage.name: Ascendant Lineage
Ascendant Lineage.description: When you use your memory of a thousand lifetimes racial power and the triggering roll still fails, you don’t expend the use of memory of a thousand lifetimes. However, you can’t use the power again until the start of your next turn.

Improved Monk Unarmed Strike.name: Improved Monk Unarmed Strike
Improved Monk Unarmed Strike.description: The damage die of your monk unarmed strike becomes 1d10, instead of 1d8.

Escape Artist.name: Escape Artist
Escape Artist.description:
You can attempt to escape a grab as a minor action, instead of as a move action.

You gain a +2 feat bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Resilient Demand.name: Resilient Demand
Resilient Demand.description: When you augment your battlemind’s demand, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

Peerless Predator (God Hunter).name: Peerless Predator (God Hunter)
Peerless Predator (God Hunter).description: Once per encounter, you can re-roll an attack roll against a creature that is higher level than you.
Peerless Predator (God Hunter).prerequisites: 21st level, ranger or rogue, God Hunter epic destiny

Wild Senses.name: Wild Senses
Wild Senses.description: Whenever you make a Perception check to find tracks, you roll twice and use either result. You also gain a +3 feat bonus to initiative checks.

Primal Fury.name: Primal Fury
Primal Fury.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with primal powers against bloodied enemies.

Defensive Mobility.name: Defensive Mobility
Defensive Mobility.description: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against opportunity attacks.

Distant Advantage.name: Distant Advantage
Distant Advantage.description: You gain combat advantage for ranged or area attacks against any enemy flanked by your allies.

Mettle.name: Mettle
Mettle.description: When an area or close attack targeting your Fortitude or Will defense misses you and still deals damage on a miss, you take no damage from the attack.

Uncanny Dodge.name: Uncanny Dodge
Uncanny Dodge.description: Enemies do not gain the normal +2 bonus to attack rolls against you when they have combat advantage. Any other benefits derived from combat advantage still apply.

Stalking Panther Form.name: Stalking Panther Form
Stalking Panther Form.description: While you are in beast form, you gain a +5 feat bonus to Stealth checks and a +4 feat bonus to initiative checks.

Hunting Wolf Form.name: Hunting Wolf Form
Hunting Wolf Form.description: While you are in beast form, you gain a +5 feat bonus to Perception checks and a +1 feat bonus to speed.

Quick Wild Shape.name: Quick Wild Shape
Quick Wild Shape.description: You can use your wild shape power as a free action during your turn.

Predator's Burst.name: Predator's Burst
Predator's Burst.description: When you charge while you are in beast form, you gain a +2 bonus to speed and a +1 bonus to the damage rolls of the charge attack.
Predator's Burst.prerequisites: Druid, Primal Predator class fea­ture, wild shape power

Eager for Blood.name: Eager for Blood
Eager for Blood.description: During the first round of combat, you avenger weapon attacks deal 1[W] extra damage.

Swordbond (Swordmage).name: Swordbond (Swordmage)
Swordbond (Swordmage).description:
By spending 1 hour of meditation with a chosen light or heavy blade, you forge a special bond with the weapon. As a standard action, you can call your bonded weapon to your hand from up to 10 squares away.

You can forge a bond with a different blade using the same meditation process (for instance, if you acquire a new blade that has magical abilities). If you forge a bond with a different blade, the old bond dissipates.

If your bonded weapon is broken or damaged, you can spend 1 hour of meditation to recreate the weapon from a fragment. (This process automatically destroys any other fragments of the weapon in existence, so you can’t use it to create multiple copies of a broken weapon.)

Swordmage Warding.name: Swordmage Warding
Swordmage Warding.description:
While you are conscious and wielding either a light blade or a heavy blade, you maintain a field of magi- cal force around you.

This field provides a +1 bonus to AC, or a +3 bonus if you are wielding a blade in one hand and have your other hand free (not carrying a shield, an off-hand weapon, a two-handed weapon, or anything else).

If you become unconscious, your Swordmage Warding benefit disappears. You can restore it by taking a short rest or an extended rest.

Swordmage Aegis.name: Swordmage Aegis
Swordmage Aegis.description:
You can place a magical warding upon a foe, allowing you to respond to the foe’s attacks against your allies with a counterassault or a timely protection.

Choose one of the following Swordmage Aegis powers. These powers are described in full below.

_Aegis of Assault_: You teleport to the side of the attacker and respond with an attack of your own.

_Aegis of Shielding_: You deflect some of the damage of an incoming attack.

Retributive Shield [Swordmage].name: Retributive Shield [Swordmage]
Retributive Shield [Swordmage].description: When you use your aegis of shielding power, you gain a +2 bonus to the next attack roll made before the end of your next turn against the foe that triggered the _aegis of shielding_ immediate interrupt.

Intelligent Blademaster [Swordmage].name: Intelligent Blademaster [Swordmage]
Intelligent Blademaster [Swordmage].description: You can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier when making a basic attack with a melee weapon.

Improved Swordbond [Swordmage].name: Improved Swordbond [Swordmage]
Improved Swordbond [Swordmage].description: You can call your bonded weapon to your hand from up to 20 squares away with a minor action.

Defensive Minions.name: Defensive Minions
Defensive Minions.description: A creature you summon using an artificer summoning power has a +2 feat bonus to all defenses.

Alchemist.name: Alchemist
Alchemist.description:
You can make alchemical items of your level or lower. You must have the correct formula and an appropriate skill.

You can take this feat instead of the Ritual Caster feat granted by your class feature.

Arcane Empowerment.name: Arcane Empowerment
Arcane Empowerment.description:
Your study of magic has given you the ability to manipulate the arcane energy contained within items. You begin each day with the ability to empower a magic item, and you gain one additional arcane empowerment for each milestone you reach.
You must spend a short rest with an item in order to empower it. You can empower an item in two ways.

Arcane Rejuvination.name: Arcane Rejuvination
Arcane Rejuvination.description: Before combat, an artificer spends time infusing his or her allies' magic items with curative energy. Whenever one of the artificers' allies uses a magic item's daily power, that ally absorbs the energy and gains temporary hit points equal to one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier.

Healing Infusion.name: Healing Infusion
Healing Infusion.description:
You can create healing infusions for later use. At the end of an extended rest, you create two healing infusions that last until the end your next extended rest. At 16th level, you instead create three healing infusion.

You determine the effect of a healing infusion at the time you use the power, not at the time you create it. When you use a healing Infusion power, you expend one of the infusions you created during your last extended rest. During a short rest, you or an ally can spend a healing surge to replenish one of the infusions expended.

Ritual Casting (Artificer).name: Ritual Casting (Artificer)
Ritual Casting (Artificer).description: You gain the Ritual Caster feat as a bonus feat, allowing you to use magical rituals. You own a ritual book, and it contains the following rituals that you have mastered: Brew Potion, Disenchant Magic Item, Enchant Magic Item, and Make Whole. In additions, you can use Disenchant Magic Item without expending components.

Master Mixer.name: Master Mixer
Master Mixer.description: You can make alchemical items of your level + 3 or lower. You must have the correct formula and an appropriate skill.

Alertness.name: Alertness
Alertness.description:
You don’t grant enemies combat advantage during surprise rounds.

You also gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception checks.

Companion Spirit.name: Companion Spirit
Companion Spirit.description:
As part of your initiation as a shaman, you acquired a spirit companion, an animal spirit that accompanies and assists you. Many shaman powers have the spirit keyword (page 220). Your spirit companion must be present when you use such a power.

You gain the call spirit companion power, which allows you to call your spirit companion to your side. In addition, choose one of the following Companion Spirit options. Your choice provides you with a Spirit Boon as well as a special attack made through your spirit companion, and your choice determines one of your at-will attack powers. Your choice also provides bonuses to certain shaman powers, as detailed in those powers.

Melee Training.name: Melee Training
Melee Training.description: Choose an ability other than Strength. When you make a melee basic attack using a weapon you are proficient with, you can use that ability instead of Strength for the attack roll and the damage roll.

Superior Implement Training.name: Superior Implement Training
Superior Implement Training.description:
You can use a Single superior implement ofyour choice. The implement must be ofa type you are already able to use.

**Special:** You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, choose a different superior implement.

Protector Spirit Adept.name: Protector Spirit Adept
Protector Spirit Adept.description: Your allies gain a +1 bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will while adjacent to your spirit companion.

Shared Healing Spirit.name: Shared Healing Spirit
Shared Healing Spirit.description: When you use healing spirit, you can choose one ally within 2 squares of the target to regain the additional hit points, instead of an ally adjacent to your spirit companion.

Font of Life.name: Font of Life
Font of Life.description:
At the start of your turn, you can make a saving throw
against one effect that a save can end. On a save, the
effect immediately ends, preventing it from affecting
you on your current turn. If you save against being
stunned or dazed, you can act normally on your turn.
If you save against ongoing damage, you avoid taking
the damage.
If you fail the saving throw, you still make a saving
throw against the effect at the end of your turn.

Earthstrength.name: Earthstrength
Earthstrength.description:
While you are not wearing heavy
armor, you can use your Constitution modifier in
place of your Dexterity or Intelligence modifier to
determine your AC.
In addition, when you use your second wind, you
gain an additional bonus to AC equal to your Constitution modifier. The bonus lasts until the end of your
next turn.

Nature's Wrath.name: Nature's Wrath
Nature's Wrath.description:
Once during each of your turns, you can mark each
adjacent enemy as a free action. This mark lasts until
the end of your next turn.

Crushing Earthstrength.name: Crushing Earthstrength
Crushing Earthstrength.description: When you use your second wind, you gain a bonus to weapon damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier until the end of your next turn.

Manifest Resistance.name: Manifest Resistance
Manifest Resistance.description: Increase the resist value provided by your elemental manifestation (if any) by 5. For example, when manifesting firesoul at 1st level to 10th level, you gain resist 10 fire (instead of resist 5 fire).

Versatile Resistance.name: Versatile Resistance
Versatile Resistance.description: You gain resist 5 cold, resist 5 fire, and resist 5 lightning regardless of your elemental manifestation.

Extra Manifestation.name: Extra Manifestation
Extra Manifestation.description: Select a new genasi elemental manifestation: earthsoul, firesoul, stormsoul, watersoul, or windsoul. When you take a short rest or an extended rest, you can adopt this new elemental manifestation instead of the one you had been exhibiting.

Stormrider.name: Stormrider
Stormrider.description: You gain a +1 feat bonus to speed when you are manifesting windsoul or watersoul. When flying, you hover.

Radiant Hammer Fists (Radiant Fist).name: Radiant Hammer Fists (Radiant Fist)
Radiant Hammer Fists (Radiant Fist).description:
Whenever your Flurry of Blows power deals damage, you
can make that damage radiant , instead of any other
damage type. In addition, whenever you score a critical hit with a monk power or a radiant fist power,
each enemy adjacent to you is blinded until the end of
your next turn.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: When an area or close attack targeting your AC or Reflex defense misses you but deals damage on a miss, you take no damage from the attack.

Brutal Flurry.name: Brutal Flurry
Brutal Flurry.description:
Whenever you target only one creature
with your Flurry of Blows power, the creature takes
2 extra damage. The extra damage increases to 4 at
21st level.
Brutal Flurry.prerequisites: 11th level, monk, Flurry of Blows class feature

Dual Soul.name: Dual Soul
Dual Soul.description: At the start of your turn, you can make a saving throw against each effect currently rendering you dazed or dominated. If you fail the saving throw, you do not make a saving throw against the effect at the end of your turn.

Arcane Initiate [Multiclass Wizard].name: Arcane Initiate [Multiclass Wizard]
Arcane Initiate [Multiclass Wizard].description:
You gain training in the Arcana skill.
Choose a 1st-level wizard at-will power. You can use that power once per encounter.
In addition, you can use an orb, a staff, or a wand as an implement when using a wizard power or a wizard paragon path power.

Staff Expertise.name: Staff Expertise
Staff Expertise.description:
You gain a +1 feat bonus to the attack rolls of implement powers and weapon powers that you use with a staff. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

In addition, when you make a ranged attack or an area attack with a staff as an implement, you don't provoke opportunity attacks for doing so.

When you make a melee weapon attack with a staff, the weapon's reach for that attack increases by 1.

Bloodbond.name: Bloodbond
Bloodbond.description: You gain the _encaging spirits_ power. In addition, while you are not wearing heavy armor, you can shift as a minor action.

Implement Focus.name: Implement Focus
Implement Focus.description:
Choose an implement with which you have proficiency. You gain a +1 feat bonus to the damage rolls of implement attacks that you make with the chosen implement. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.

Special: You can choose this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose another implement with which you have proficiency

Dilettante.name: Dilettante
Dilettante.description: At 1st level, you choose an at-will power from a class different from yours. You can use that power as an encounter power.

Dual Heritage.name: Dual Heritage
Dual Heritage.description: You can take feats that have either elf or human as a prerequisite (as well as those specifically for half-elves), as long as you meet any other requirements.

Group Diplomacy.name: Group Diplomacy
Group Diplomacy.description: You grant allies within 10 squares of you a +1 racial bonus to Diplomacy checks.

Prime Shot.name: Prime Shot
Prime Shot.description: If none of your allies are nearer to your target than you are, you receive a +1 bonus to ranged attack rolls against that target.

Shadow Walk.name: Shadow Walk
Shadow Walk.description: On your turn, if you move at least 3 squares away from where you started your turn, you gain concealment until the end of your next turn.

Warlock's Curse.name: Warlock's Curse
Warlock's Curse.description:
Once per turn as a minor action, you can place a Warlock’s Curse on the enemy nearest to you that you can see. A cursed enemy is more vulnerable to your attacks. If you damage a cursed enemy, you deal extra damage. You decide whether to apply the extra damage after making the damage roll. You can deal this extra damage once per round.
A Warlock’s Curse remains in effect until the end of the encounter or until the cursed enemy drops to 0 hit points or fewer.
You can place a Warlock’s Curse on multiple targets over the course of an encounter; each curse requires the use of a minor action. You can’t place a Warlock’s Curse on a creature that is already affected by your or another character’s Warlock’s Curse.

As you advance in level, your extra damage increases.
Level Warlock’s Curse Extra Damage
1st–10th +1d6
11th–20th +2d6
21st–30th +3d6

Killing Curse.name: Killing Curse
Killing Curse.description: The extra damage dice from your Warlock's Curse class feature increase from d6s to d8s.

Darkspiral Aura.name: Darkspiral Aura
Darkspiral Aura.description:
When an enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, add 1 to your Darkspiral Aura. Your Darkspiral Aura has a starting value of 0, and it resets to 0 when you take a short rest or an extended rest.
Once per round as a free action when an enemy makes a melee attack or a ranged attack against you,
you can use your Darkspiral Aura as an immediate interrupt, dealing 1d6 necrotic and psychic damage
to that enemy for each point of your Darkspiral Aura’s current value. If this attack deals less than 12 damage, the value of your Darkspiral Aura becomes 0. If this attack deals 12 damage or more, you can
cause the enemy to be weakened for its attack (which means the attack deals half damage), and the value of your Darkspiral Aura becomes 1.
At 11th level, the damage you deal increases to 1d8 per point of your Darkspiral Aura’s current value,
and at 21st level the damage increases to 1d10 per point of your Darkspiral Aura’s current value.

Scholar Theme Starting Feature.name: Scholar Theme Starting Feature
Scholar Theme Starting Feature.description: You know one additional language chosen from Draconic, Dwarven, and Elven. In addition, you gain the Use Vulnerability power.

Scholar Theme Level 5 Feature.name: Scholar Theme Level 5 Feature
Scholar Theme Level 5 Feature.description:
Choose training in one new skill and one new language. The skill you choose must be Arcana,
Dungeoneering, History, Nature, or Religion; if you already have training in all of these skills, you instead gain a +2 bonus to skill checks with one of those skills. 
The language you choose must be Draconic, Dwarven, or Elven; if you already know all three, choose one language from those listed in the Rules Compendium (page 69) or Player's Handbook (page 25).

Pledge of Retribution.name: Pledge of Retribution
Pledge of Retribution.description: If you miss your oath of enmity target with an attack, you gain a +1 bonus to the next attack roll you make against that target before the end of your next turn.
Pledge of Retribution.prerequisites: 11th level, avenger, Censure of Retribution class feature, oath of enmity power

Astral Majesty.name: Astral Majesty
Astral Majesty.description: You have a +1 to all defenses against attacks made by bloodied creatures.

Astral Resistance.name: Astral Resistance
Astral Resistance.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage equal to 5 + one-half your level.

Immortal Origin.name: Immortal Origin
Immortal Origin.description: Your spirit is native to the Astral Sea, so you are considered an immortal creature for the purpose of effects that relate to creature origin.

Armor of Faith.name: Armor of Faith
Armor of Faith.description: The favor of your deity wards you from harm. While you are neither wearing heavy armor nor using a shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC.

Censure of Retribution.name: Censure of Retribution
Censure of Retribution.description: When any enemy other than your oath of enmity target hits you, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn. This bonus is cumulative.

Devout Guidance.name: Devout Guidance
Devout Guidance.description: When you use your divine guidance, the target gains a +3 power bonus to the second attack roll.

Inspired Recovery.name: Inspired Recovery
Inspired Recovery.description: When an ally who can see you spends an action point to take an extra action, that ally also regains hit points equal to one-half your level + your Charisma modifier.

Lightning Reflexes.name: Lightning Reflexes
Lightning Reflexes.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to your Reflex defense.

Skill Training.name: Skill Training
Skill Training.description:
You gain training in one skill. The skill need not be on your class skill list.

**Special:** You can take this feat more than once. Each time you select this feat, choose a skill in which you are not trained.

Combat Commander.name: Combat Commander
Combat Commander.description: The bonus to initiative granted by your Combat Leader class feature is now equal to your Charisma modifier or your Intelligence modifier, whichever is higher.

Bolstering Mantle.name: Bolstering Mantle
Bolstering Mantle.description: Whenever you spend a healing surge, one ally within the radius of your Ardent Mantle can either  gain 5 temporary hit points or make a saving throw.

Heartening Surge.name: Heartening Surge
Heartening Surge.description: The bonus that your _ardent surge_ grants to either defenses or attack rolls increases by 1.

Mantle of Caution.name: Mantle of Caution
Mantle of Caution.description: While you are bloodied, allies within the radius of your Ardent Mantle gain a +2 bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will.
Mantle of Caution.prerequisites: 11th level, ardent, Ardent Mantle class feature

Psionic Toughness [Augment].name: Psionic Toughness [Augment]
Psionic Toughness [Augment].description:
When you take this feat, you gain additional hit points. You gain 3 additional hit points at each tier of play (at 1st, 11th, and 21st level).

In addition, when you use your second wind, you can spend 1 power point to regain 5 additional hit points. The additional hit points regained increase to 10 at 11th level and 15 at 21st level.

Improved Ardent Surge.name: Improved Ardent Surge
Improved Ardent Surge.description: The target of your ardent surge regains additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Empowered Dragon Breath [Dragonborn].name: Empowered Dragon Breath [Dragonborn]
Empowered Dragon Breath [Dragonborn].description: Use d10s for the damage roll of your dragon breath power instead of d6s.

Combat Medic.name: Combat Medic
Combat Medic.description:
You administer first aid to stabilize the dying as a minor action, instead of a standard action.
You also gain a +2 feat bonus to Heal checks.

Reinvigorating Attack [Invincible Mind P.name: Reinvigorating Attack [Invincible Mind Path Feature]
Reinvigorating Attack [Invincible Mind P.description: When you have 0 power points and hit an enemy with a battle­mind at-will attack that is unaugmented, you regain 2 power points.

Epic Reflexes.name: Epic Reflexes
Epic Reflexes.description: You gain a +4 bonus to Reflex.

Epic Will.name: Epic Will
Epic Will.description: You gain a +4 bonus to Will.

Indomitable Will.name: Indomitable Will
Indomitable Will.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Will and saving throws against effects that make you dazed, dominated, or stunned.

Opportune Reflexes.name: Opportune Reflexes
Opportune Reflexes.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Reflex and saving throws against ongoing damage.

Invincible [Invincible Mind Path Feature.name: Invincible [Invincible Mind Path Feature]
Invincible [Invincible Mind Path Feature.description: When you drop to 0 hit points or fewer,you can spend a healing surge as an immediate interrupt.

Invigorating Demand.name: Invigorating Demand
Invigorating Demand.description: When you augment your *battlemind’s demand*, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.

Rune of Destruction (Runepriest).name: Rune of Destruction (Runepriest)
Rune of Destruction (Runepriest).description: Allies gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against enemies that are adjacent to you or to any other runepriests who are in this rune state.

Rune of Protection (Runepriest).name: Rune of Protection (Runepriest)
Rune of Protection (Runepriest).description: While adjacent to you, allies gain resist 2 to all damage. The resistance increases to 4 at 11th level and 6 at 21st level.

Wrathful Hammer (Runepriest).name: Wrathful Hammer (Runepriest)
Wrathful Hammer (Runepriest).description:
You gain proficiency with
military hammers and military maces. In addition,
whenever an enemy deals damage to you with an
attack. you gain a bonus to damage rolls against that
enemy until the end of your next turn. The bonus
equals your Constitution modifier, regardless of the
number of times the enemy damages you in a round.

Deific Agony (Godhunter).name: Deific Agony (Godhunter)
Deific Agony (Godhunter).description: When you score a critical hit against a creature that is higher level than you, the creature takes a –5 penalty to saving throws and cannot regain hit points or recharge any powers until the end of your next turn.
Deific Agony (Godhunter).prerequisites: 24th level, ranger or rogue, God Hunter epic destiny

Blasphemous Recovery (Godhunter).name: Blasphemous Recovery (Godhunter)
Blasphemous Recovery (Godhunter).description: Once per day, when you are hit by an attack from a creature that is higher level than you, you can choose to treat that attack as a miss and then regain the use of second wind and the use of one encounter power you have used during this encounter.
Blasphemous Recovery (Godhunter).prerequisites: 30th level, ranger or rogue, God Hunter epic destiny

Light Blade Mastery.name: Light Blade Mastery
Light Blade Mastery.description: When you make a melee weapon attack with a light blade, you can score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

Unfettered Stride.name: Unfettered Stride
Unfettered Stride.description: You can ignore the effect of difficult terrain on your movement.

Rune of Hope [Rune].name: Rune of Hope [Rune]
Rune of Hope [Rune].description: The target of your rune of mending also gains temporary hit points equal to the number of rune feats you have.

Rune of Zeal [Rune].name: Rune of Zeal [Rune]
Rune of Zeal [Rune].description:
You gain a feat bonus to Athletics checks
and Endurance checks equal to the number of rune
feats you have.

Robust Defenses.name: Robust Defenses
Robust Defenses.description: You gain a +2 feat bonus to Fortitude, Reflex, and Will.

Rune of Vengeance [Rune].name: Rune of Vengeance [Rune]
Rune of Vengeance [Rune].description:
The first time you are bloodied during an encounter, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to
the number of rune feats you have. The bonus lasts
until the end of your next turn.

Rune of Eloquence [Rune].name: Rune of Eloquence [Rune]
Rune of Eloquence [Rune].description:
You gain a feat bonus to Bluff checks and
Diplomacy checks equal to the number of rune feats you have.

Markings of the Victor.name: Markings of the Victor
Markings of the Victor.description:
The first time you make an attack roll
during each encounter, you can roll twice and use
either result.

Markings of the Blessed.name: Markings of the Blessed
Markings of the Blessed.description:
The first time you make a saving throw
during each encounter, you can roll twice and use
either result.

Impending Victory.name: Impending Victory
Impending Victory.description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with
at-will powers against bloodied creatures.

Axe Mastery.name: Axe Mastery
Axe Mastery.description:
When you make a melee weapon attack
with an axe, you can score a critical hit on a natural
roll of 19 or 20.

Divine Mastery.name: Divine Mastery
Divine Mastery.description:
When you spend an action point to
take an extra action, you also regain the use of a
divine encounter power you have used during this
encounter.

Rune of Health [Rune].name: Rune of Health [Rune]
Rune of Health [Rune].description:
Each ally, other than the target, in the
burst of your rune of mending regains hit points equal
to 3 + the number of rune feats you have.
Rune of Health [Rune].prerequisites: 21st level, runepriest, rune of mending power

Clinging Radiance.name: Clinging Radiance
Clinging Radiance.description: When you hit a target with a divine attack power that has the radiant keyword, the target loses any concealment or total concealment it has and cannot gain concealment or total concealment until the end of your next turn.

Saving Grace.name: Saving Grace
Saving Grace.description: When you succeed on a saving throw, you can choose not to end the effect you saved against and instead allow and ally within 5 square of you to make a saving throw with a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the.name: Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the Forge Path Feature]
Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the.description:
When you take a short or an extended rest, you can touch
one weapon that you or an ally carries. That weapon
then gains a +1 bonus to damage rolls until you grant
this bonus to a different weapon.
Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the.prerequisites: 11th level, master of the forge paragon destiny
Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the.id: Runes of the Blade Smith [Master of the Forge Path Feature]

Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge P.name: Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge Path Feature]
Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge P.description:
When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you and
each ally within 5 squares of you gain a +4 bonus to
weapon damage rolls until the end of your next turn.
Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge P.prerequisites: 11th level, master of the forge paragon destiny
Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge P.id: Forge Rune Action [Master of the Forge Path Feature]

Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge P.name: Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge Path Feature]
Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge P.description:
When you take
a short or an extended rest, you can touch one suit of
heavy armor that you or an ally wears. That armor
gains a +1 bonus to AC until you grant this bonus to a
different suit of armor.
Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge P.prerequisites: 16th level, master of the forge paragon path
Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge P.id: Indomitable Steel [Master of the Forge Path Feature]

Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Fea.name: Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Feature]
Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Fea.description: Allies adjacent to you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against being dominated, immobilized, restrained, or slowed.
Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Fea.prerequisites: 21st level, avatar of freedom epic destiny
Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Fea.id: Liberate the Mind [Avatar of Freedom Feature]

Liberating Revival [Avatar of Freedom Fe.name: Liberating Revival [Avatar of Freedom Feature]
Liberating Revival [Avatar of Freedom Fe.description:
The first time
each day you begin your turn dying or dead, you revive. You regain hit points equal to your bloodied value, and each ally within 10 squares of you ends any immobilizing,
 slowing, or restraining effect currently affecting him or her.
Liberating Revival [Avatar of Freedom Fe.prerequisites: 24th level, avatar of freedom epic destiny

Icon of Hope.name: Icon of Hope
Icon of Hope.description: Bloodied allies withing 10 squares of you gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.

Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feat.name: Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feature]
Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feat.description: You cannot be dominated, immobilized, slowed, restrained, or petrified . You ignore difficult terrain, and you can shift your speed as a move action.
Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feat.prerequisites: 30th level, avatar of freedom epic destiny
Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feat.id: Agent of Freedom [Avatar of Freedom Feature]

Magnificent Beast.name: Magnificent Beast
Magnificent Beast.description: When you use  wild shape to change from your humanoid form to beast form, you can change your size to Large. While you are in a Large beast form, you gain a +2 bonus to  damage roll  and speed.

Rune of Battle [Rune].name: Rune of Battle [Rune]
Rune of Battle [Rune].description:
Whenever you score a critical hit with a
runepriest power, one ally adjacent to the target can
make a melee basic attack against that target as a free
action. The ally gains a bonus to the attack roll and
the damage roll equal to the number of rune feats you
have.

Sovereign's Charge.name: Sovereign's Charge
Sovereign's Charge.description: Once per encounter when you charge while in beast form, you can use one of your beast form encounter attack powers in place of a melee basic attack. If the attack hits, the  target is also knocked prone.

Divine Health.name: Divine Health
Divine Health.description: You gain resistance to poison equal to one-half your level + your wisdom modifier. You can't become infected by any disease of level 30 or lower.

Sovereign's Inheritance.name: Sovereign's Inheritance
Sovereign's Inheritance.description: When you reduce a nonminion enemy to 0 hit points with a beast form attack power, you can choose either to spend a healing surge or to regain the use of an encounter attack power that you  have used during this encounter.

Primal Aspect Form.name: Primal Aspect Form
Primal Aspect Form.description: While you are bloodied in beast form, you gain regeneration 2.

Primal Resurgence.name: Primal Resurgence
Primal Resurgence.description: Once per day, when you become bloodied, as a free action you can regain the use of a primal daily power you have already used today.

Epic Resurgence.name: Epic Resurgence
Epic Resurgence.description: The first time you score a critical hit during an encounter, you regain the use of one encounter attack power of your choice. If you use an attack that targets multiple foes, you gain this feat’s benefit only on the first attack roll you make.

Mantle of Clarity.name: Mantle of Clarity
Mantle of Clarity.description:
You and each ally within 5 squares of you gain a bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier.
In addition, each ally within 5 squares of you gains a +2 bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.
You also gain the _ardent alacrity_ power.

Mark of Healing [Dragonmark].name: Mark of Healing [Dragonmark]
Mark of Healing [Dragonmark].description:
Benefit: Whenever you use a healing power on an ally or use Heal to allow an ally to spend his or her second wind, that ally can also make a saving throw.

You can master and perform rituals in the restoration category and the Remove Affliction (PHB1 p.311) ritual as if you had the Ritual Caster feat.

Storm Spellfury.name: Storm Spellfury
Storm Spellfury.description: Whenever you use a sorcerer at-will attack power and hit at least one enemy, you can fly 2 squares as a free action after resolving the attack.
Storm Spellfury.prerequisites: 11th level, sorcerer, Storm Magic class feature

[Storm Sovereign] Stormborn.name: [Storm Sovereign] Stormborn
[Storm Sovereign] Stormborn.description: You increase your Constitution score by 2 and your origin changes to elemental. Additionally, you gain resist lightning and thunder equal to 15 + one-half your level.

Draconic Restoration.name: Draconic Restoration
Draconic Restoration.description: When you use your second wind, you regain the use of your dragon breath.
Draconic Restoration.prerequisites: 21st level, dragonborn, dragon breath racial power

Underfoot.name: Underfoot
Underfoot.description:
You can move through the space of a creature two or more sizes larger than you (Large or larger) without provoking opportunity attacks from that creature. You don’t provoke when you leave an adjacent square to enter the target creature’s space, or when you leave the target creature’s space to enter an adjacent square.

You still provoke attacks from other creatures. You can’t end your move in another creature’s space.

Crossbow Expertise.name: Crossbow Expertise
Crossbow Expertise.description:
You gain a +1 feat bonus to weapon attack rolls that you make with a crossbow. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level and +3 at 21st level.
Also you ignore partial cover and superior cover with weapon attacks you make with a crossbow.

Secret Stride.name: Secret Stride
Secret Stride.description: You do not incur penalties to your Stealth checks if you move at full speed while hiding or sneaking. You still take the full penalty if you run.

Steady Shooter.name: Steady Shooter
Steady Shooter.description: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls with crossbow attacks if you haven't moved since the end of your last turn.

Seize the Moment.name: Seize the Moment
Seize the Moment.description: During the first round of combat and during surprise rounds, you automatically gain combat advantage over a foe whose initiative result is lower than yours.

Combat Opportunity.name: Combat Opportunity
Combat Opportunity.description: Whenever one of your allies hits an enemy with an opportunity attack, that enemy grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Expert Sneak.name: Expert Sneak
Expert Sneak.description: You have combat advantage against enemies that are deafened, immobilized, slowed, or weakened.

Merciless Killer.name: Merciless Killer
Merciless Killer.description: When a bloodied foe grants combat advantage to you, you gain a +5 bonus to the damage roll.

Martial Mastery.name: Martial Mastery
Martial Mastery.description: When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you also regain the use of a martial encounter power you have used during this encounter.

Darkfire Warrior.name: Darkfire Warrior
Darkfire Warrior.description: When you reduce the target of your _Darkfire_ racial power to zero hit points with a weapon attack, you regain the use of _Darkfire._

Two-Fisted Shooter.name: Two-Fisted Shooter
Two-Fisted Shooter.description: You can treat the hand crossbow as an offhand weapon and you can reload it one-handed as a free action. When you score a critical hit and have a hand crossbow in your offhand you can make a ranged basic attack with that weapon.

Fey Origin.name: Fey Origin
Fey Origin.description: Your ancestors were native to the Feywild, so you are considered a few creature for the purpose of effects that relate to creature origin.

Sharpshooter Talent.name: Sharpshooter Talent
Sharpshooter Talent.description: Choose crossbows or slings. You gain a +1 bonus to attack with any weapon of the chosen group. You gain _Far Shot_ as a bonus feat, even if you do not meet the prerequisites.

Trance.name: Trance
Trance.description: Rather than sleep, drow enter a meditative state known as a trance. You need to spend 4 hours in this state to gain the same benefits other races gain from taking a 6-hour extended rest. While in a trance, you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

Crossbow Savant.name: Crossbow Savant
Crossbow Savant.description: You add 5 squares to the normal range of any crossbow you wield and 10 squares to the long range.Treat a hand crossbow as an offhand weapon. Treat any crossbow that has the load minor property as having the load free property instead.

Sniper Action.name: Sniper Action
Sniper Action.description: When you spend an action point to make a ranged basic attack and have combat advantage against the target of the attack, you can add your sneak attack damage, even if you have already dealt sneak attack damage during this round. If the attack hits, you can shift one square.

Versatile Combatant.name: Versatile Combatant
Versatile Combatant.description: When you are armed with a melee weapon in your main hand, and a hand crossbow in your offhand, you do not provoke opportunity attacks when attacking with your hand crossbow.

Death's Eye.name: Death's Eye
Death's Eye.description: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points, choose another enemy you can see. Until the end of your next turn, you gain combat advantage against the second enemy, and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you.

Student of Battle [Multiclass Warlord].name: Student of Battle [Multiclass Warlord]
Student of Battle [Multiclass Warlord].description:
You gain training in one skill from the warlord's class skill list.
Once per day, you can use the warlord's _inspiring word_ power.

[Storm Sovereign] Thunder and Lightning.name: [Storm Sovereign] Thunder and Lightning
[Storm Sovereign] Thunder and Lightning.description:
Once per day, when you die, your body discorporates into a storm of elemental fury. You heal to one-half hit points and gain the insubstantial and phasing qualities. You gain an aura 5; when any enemy begins its turn inside that aura, it automatically takes 15 lightning and thunder damage, and you can slide that enemy 3 squares. You can use encounter and at-will powers, but you cannot use daily powers, activate magic items, or perform rituals. If you die in elemental storm form, you are dead.
